citation.article-title: Psychroserpens burtonensis gen. nov., sp. nov., and Gelidibacter algens gen. nov., sp. nov., psychrophilic bacteria isolated from antarctic lacustrine and sea ice habitats

p.s: Psychroserpens. (Psy. chro.ser'pens. Gr. adj. psychros, cold; L. n. serpens, serpent; M.L. n. Psychroserpens, cold serpent)
Morphology varies with the age of the culture.
Young cultures contain rodlike or vibrioid cells that are 2 to 6 μm long and 0.5 to 0.6 μm wide, and coiled and helical filamentous cells up to 20 μm long also frequently occur.
Cells in older cultures eventually transform into nonrefractile, coccoid cells that are 0.5 to 2.0 μm in diameter.
Requires seawater, yeast extract, and/or vitamins for growth.
The major cellular lipids are il5:1ω10c, a15:1ω10c, i15:0, a15:0, 15:10ω11c, 15:1ω4c, 15:0, and i16:1ω11c.
Member of the family Flavobacteriaceae (located on the [Flexibacter] maritimus 16s rRNA branch).
The genus contains one species, Psychroserpens burtonensis, which is the type species.
